# Template: Witness Statement Skeleton

<!-- 
  Purpose: Provide structure for compliant witness statements under CPR Part 32.
  Usage: Adapt for factual witnesses in contentious probate matters.
  Critical: Must be in witness's own words, first person, and comply with CPR requirements.
-->

---

**IN THE HIGH COURT OF JUSTICE**  
**BUSINESS AND PROPERTY COURTS**  
**CHANCERY DIVISION**

Claim No: [Insert claim number]

---

**BETWEEN:**

**[CLAIMANT NAME]**  
*Claimant*

-and-

**[DEFENDANT NAME]**  
*Defendant*

---

## WITNESS STATEMENT OF [WITNESS FULL NAME]

**[First / Second / Third] Witness Statement**

---

**I, [FULL NAME], of [full address], [occupation], WILL SAY as follows:**

---

### 1. Introduction and Source of Knowledge

1.1 I am [the Claimant / the Defendant / describe relationship, e.g., "the son of the late [Deceased's name]" / "the solicitor who prepared the will" / "the care home manager who cared for the deceased"].

1.2 I make this statement in support of [the Claimant's / the Defendant's] case [and in response to the witness statement of [name] dated [date]].

1.3 The facts set out in this statement are within my own knowledge unless otherwise stated. Where I refer to information provided by others, I identify my source.

1.4 [IF EXHIBITS] There is now shown to me a bundle of documents marked "[Initials]-[Number]" which I refer to in this statement. [The contents of this exhibit are true copies of original documents.]

---

### 2. Background and Relationship to This Matter

**Personal Background:**

2.1 I am [age] years old, born on [date of birth].

2.2 [Describe occupation, relevant experience, background that explains perspective/knowledge].

**Relationship to the Deceased:**

2.3 I [describe relationship to deceased - e.g., "am the eldest son of the late [Deceased's name]" / "knew the deceased for [X] years as [describe relationship]"].

2.4 [Describe nature and closeness of relationship, frequency of contact, relevance to issues in the case].

**Relationship to This Case:**

2.5 [Explain why you are providing this evidence and what matters you can speak to].

---

### 3. Chronological Account of Events

[ORGANIZE CHRONOLOGICALLY IN NUMBERED PARAGRAPHS]

**[Section Heading - e.g., "The Deceased's Health and Capacity"]**

3.1 [First relevant event or period]. I remember this because [explain how you remember/why significant].

3.2 [Continue chronologically with numbered paragraphs].

3.3 [Include specific dates where known, approximate dates where not certain - e.g., "This was in early 2020, I believe around February or March"].

3.4 [Reference documents where relevant]: I refer to page [X] of exhibit [Initials]-[Number], which is [describe document]. [This shows / confirms that] [relevance].

---

**[EXAMPLE SECTIONS FOR DIFFERENT TYPES OF CONTENTIOUS PROBATE CASES:]**

---

### [FOR CAPACITY CASES] The Deceased's Mental State and Capacity

**General Observations:**

[X].1 During [time period], I saw the deceased [frequency]. On these occasions, I observed that [describe observations of mental state, behavior, understanding].

**Specific Incidents:**

[X].2 On [specific date], I visited the deceased at [location]. [Describe what happened - conversation, behavior, confusion, lucidity, etc.].

[X].3 [Provide specific examples with dates and details rather than generalities].

**Understanding of Financial Affairs:**

[X].4 [If relevant] The deceased [could / could not] manage [his/her] financial affairs. For example, [specific examples].

**Understanding of Family and Relationships:**

[X].5 The deceased [recognized / did not recognize] family members. [Specific examples].

[X].6 [He/She] [understood / did not understand] [his/her] family relationships and obligations. [Examples].

**Medical Treatment and Medication:**

[X].7 I am aware that the deceased [was being treated for / was taking medication for] [conditions]. [Explain how you know - e.g., "I took him/her to appointments" / "I was told by [source]"].

[X].8 [Describe impact of conditions/medication on deceased if observed].

---

### [FOR UNDUE INFLUENCE CASES] Relationship Between [Influencer] and the Deceased

**Nature of Relationship:**

[X].1 [Name of alleged influencer] was [relationship to deceased - e.g., "the deceased's daughter and primary carer"].

[X].2 [Describe the dynamics of this relationship, including dependency, power imbalance, access].

**Control and Isolation:**

[X].3 From around [date/period], I noticed that [influencer] [describe controlling behavior].

[X].4 [Specific examples]: On [date], [describe incident showing control or isolation].

[X].5 [Influencer] [prevented / restricted / controlled] contact between the deceased and [family members / friends]. [Specific examples].

**Deceased's Vulnerability:**

[X].6 During this period, the deceased was vulnerable because [age / health / dependence / other].

**Changes in Deceased's Behavior:**

[X].7 I noticed that the deceased [became more withdrawn / expressed fear of displeasing [influencer] / was reluctant to express own wishes / other changes].

[X].8 [Specific examples of incidents].

---

### [FOR KNOWLEDGE AND APPROVAL CASES] Circumstances of Will Preparation

**Will Preparation:**

[X].1 [IF WITNESS TO WILL PREPARATION] On [date], I was [present when the will was prepared / asked to witness the will / other role].

[X].2 [Describe who was present, what happened, whether testator appeared to understand, whether testator read will, etc.].

**Testator's Understanding:**

[X].3 The deceased [did / did not] appear to understand what [he/she] was signing. [Describe observations].

[X].4 [He/She] [read / did not read] the will before signing.

[X].5 [Describe any concerns, unusual circumstances, involvement of beneficiaries].

**Attendance of Beneficiary:**

[X].6 [IF RELEVANT] [Beneficiary name] was present throughout [and appeared to be directing the process / and was very involved / other observations].

---

### [FOR FAMILY PROVISION CASES] Financial Position and Needs

**The Deceased's Financial Support:**

[X].1 Before [his/her] death, the deceased [provided financial support / maintained me / other]. Specifically:

[X].2 [He/She] paid [describe - e.g., "£X per month toward my living expenses" / "my rent" / "university fees"].

[X].3 [Continue with specific details of financial dependency].

**My Current Financial Position:**

[X].4 My current income is [amount] per [month/year] from [sources].

[X].5 My capital/savings are approximately £[amount].

[X].6 My expenses are approximately £[amount] per [month/year], comprising: [brief breakdown or reference to schedule].

[X].7 I [own / rent / live in [description of accommodation]]. [Relevant details about housing position].

**My Needs:**

[X].8 [Describe needs - housing, income, care, health-related, children's needs, etc.].

[X].9 [Explain why provision under will/intestacy is insufficient for reasonable needs].

---

### [FOR PROPRIETARY ESTOPPEL] Assurances and Reliance

**Assurances Made:**

[X].1 On [date or approximate date], the deceased told me that [quote exact words as closely as possible].

[X].2 [He/She] said this [on multiple occasions / in the presence of [witnesses] / in [circumstances]].

[X].3 [Provide specific details of each occasion an assurance was made].

**My Understanding and Belief:**

[X].4 I understood this to mean [explain understanding]. I believed the deceased [would leave me [property] / intended me to inherit].

**Reliance:**

[X].5 In reliance on what the deceased told me, I [describe actions taken in reliance].

[X].6 [Specific examples with dates]: In [year], I [gave up my job / moved to the area / invested money / worked without pay / other].

**Detriment:**

[X].7 As a result, I [suffered detriment]. Specifically, [quantify and describe].

[X].8 If I had not relied on the deceased's assurances, I would have [describe what witness would have done instead].

---

### 4. Documents

4.1 I refer to the following documents [in exhibit [Initials]-[Number] / which I understand have been disclosed]:

- [Document 1 - brief description and relevance]
- [Document 2 - brief description and relevance]

4.2 [For key documents, explain what they show and their significance].

---

### 5. Response to Other Evidence (if applicable)

5.1 I have [read / been informed of the contents of] the witness statement of [name] dated [date].

5.2 [Paragraph X] of that statement [states / alleges / suggests] that [summarize].

5.3 This is [not correct / incomplete / misleading] because [explain your evidence on this point].

5.4 [Address each significant disputed point in the other witness statement].

---

### 6. Conclusion

6.1 [Brief summary of key points if appropriate].

6.2 [I believe the facts stated in this witness statement are true. / I am informed that the facts stated in this witness statement are true.]* [*Second option only if statement made by someone other than witness, e.g., translator - very rare]

---

**STATEMENT OF TRUTH**

I believe that the facts stated in this witness statement are true. I understand that proceedings for contempt of court may be brought against anyone who makes, or causes to be made, a false statement in a document verified by a statement of truth without an honest belief in its truth.

---

**Signed:** ..........................................

**[FULL NAME]**

**Dated:** [Date]

---

## EXHIBITS

[IF EXHIBITS, FOLLOW WITH EXHIBIT PAGES]

---

**THIS IS THE EXHIBIT MARKED "[Initials]-[Number]" REFERRED TO IN THE WITNESS STATEMENT OF [WITNESS NAME] DATED [DATE]**

---

**Before me:**

**Signed:** ..........................................  
[Solicitor name]  
[Solicitor for the Claimant/Defendant]

---

[THEN PAGINATED DOCUMENTS REFERRED TO IN STATEMENT]

---

## Drafting Guidance

### CPR Compliance

**Requirements (CPR 32 and PD 32):**
- Heading with case title and number
- First person ("I saw" not "the witness saw")
- Numbered paragraphs
- Witness's own words and style (not lawyer's language)
- State source of knowledge/information
- Exhibits properly marked
- Statement of truth
- Signed and dated

### Content Guidelines

**Do:**
- Use witness's own language and expressions
- Be specific - dates, places, people, amounts
- Explain how witness remembers or knows information
- Distinguish between what witness saw/heard directly and what they were told
- Reference documents by exhibit number and page
- Keep chronological where possible
- Be honest about what witness doesn't remember or doesn't know

**Don't:**
- Use legal jargon or lawyer's language
- Make legal arguments (that's for submissions)
- Include opinion unless expert witness
- Include hearsay without identifying source
- Exaggerate or overstate
- Speculate or guess
- Include irrelevant material

### Exhibits

**Rules:**
- Mark as "[Witness Initials]-[Sequential Number]"
- Exhibit page identifies witness, statement date, exhibit marker
- Solicitor signs exhibit page
- Documents paginated consecutively
- Index if multiple documents
- Only exhibit relevant documents
- Don't exhibit other witness statements or pleadings

### Preparation Process

**Before Drafting:**
- [ ] Meet with witness and explain process
- [ ] Gather witness's documents
- [ ] Identify relevant events and information
- [ ] Check dates and facts where possible

**Drafting:**
- [ ] Use witness's own words (not your words)
- [ ] Read back to witness for accuracy
- [ ] Ensure witness understands and agrees
- [ ] Check chronology and consistency
- [ ] Verify facts mentioned

**Before Finalizing:**
- [ ] Witness reviews and confirms accuracy
- [ ] Check against requirements in PD 32
- [ ] Peer review for compliance and quality
- [ ] Exhibits properly prepared and marked
- [ ] Statement of truth explained to witness
- [ ] Signed and dated

### Common Mistakes to Avoid

- Too much legal argument
- Using lawyer's language not witness's
- Vague generalizations instead of specific facts
- Failing to exhibit key documents
- Improper exhibit marking
- No statement of truth
- Unsigned or undated
